{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker

    | name      = Unknown Speaker

{{TranscriptBlock

{{TranscriptBlock

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker

{{TranscriptBlock

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:32:25.400
    | text      = So here is my modest proposal to not eat the children, but actually eat the people that trigger the global depression.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:32:32.400
    | text      = I'm Alex Jones, and this is the Infowar.

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:32:35.400
    | text      = The definition of satire is not pointing out absurdity by being absurd.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:32:39.400
    | text      = Merriam-Webster defines it as, quote, a literary work holding up human vices and follies to ridicule or scorn.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:32:45.400
    | text      = A second definition is, quote, trenchant wit, irony, or sarcasm used to expose and discredit vice or folly.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:32:52.400
    | text      = This is going to end up being a very standard definition, and that second part is honestly the part Alex seems to be missing.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:32:58.400
    | text      = Satire is directed, it's targeted, specifically toward a societal vice or folly,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:33:03.400
    | text      = which is heightened and laid bare by the use of irony, humor, or even sometimes absurdity.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:33:08.400
    | text      = A modest proposal is held up as an enduring piece of literary satire because what it did was use a grotesque and ironic suggestion
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:33:17.400
    | text      = to expose and mock the prevailing attitudes society had towards the poor.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:33:21.400
    | text      = Swift used the idea of eating poor children as a way of highlighting how attempts to help the impoverished had been stupid ideas themselves,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:33:28.400
    | text      = and it was a problem to be taken seriously.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:33:30.400
    | text      = Conversely, Alex was not talking about any greater societal folly or vice in his diatribe about eating his neighbors.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:33:36.400
    | text      = He was not talking about this as a solution to worldwide hunger like he seems to want to pretend now.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:33:41.400
    | text      = He was not talking about it because his neighbors were rich and somehow they're the ones responsible for the worldwide depression he thinks we can avoid by going back to work prematurely.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:33:49.400
    | text      = Alex was just talking about eating his neighbors because he imagined a scenario where his children needed food.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:33:56.400
    | text      = It was that simple. It's not satire.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:33:59.400
    | text      = What Alex did fails to be satire because it didn't have a larger meaning.
